thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Mnuchin Unconcerned by Pacific Trade Agreement That Excludes U.S.

author: Deborah Ball
title: Mnuchin Unconcerned by Pacific Trade Agreement That Excludes U.S.
text:
DAVOS, Switzerland—U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin brushed off worries about the dollar Wednesday and expressed little concern over the decision by 11 Pacific Rim countries to forge a new commercial bloc that excludes the U.S.
“Where it is short term isn’t a concern at all,” the Treasury secretary said of the dollar, which has weakened sharply in recent weeks. “A weaker dollar is good for trade. In the longer term, a stronger dollar is a reflection of the strength of the U.S. economy.”
...
